problem_names: lemma disjE3: "P \<or> Q \<or> R \<Longrightarrow> (P \<Longrightarrow> S) \<Longrightarrow> (Q \<Longrightarrow> S) \<Longrightarrow> (R \<Longrightarrow> S) \<Longrightarrow> S"

lemma ge_induct[consumes 1, case_names step]:
  fixes i::nat and j::nat and P::"nat \<Rightarrow> bool"
  shows "i \<le> j \<Longrightarrow> (\<And>n. i \<le> n \<Longrightarrow> ((\<forall>m \<ge> i.  m<n \<longrightarrow> P m) \<Longrightarrow> P n)) \<Longrightarrow> P j"

lemma my_induct[consumes 1, case_names base step]:
  fixes P::"nat\<Rightarrow>bool"
assumes less: "i \<le> j"
    and base: "P j"
    and step: "\<And>n. i \<le> n \<Longrightarrow> n < j \<Longrightarrow> (\<forall>n'>n. n'\<le>j \<longrightarrow> P n') \<Longrightarrow> P n"
  shows "P i"
lemma Greatest_ex_le_nat: assumes "\<exists>k. P k \<and> (\<forall>k'. P k' \<longrightarrow> k' \<le> k)" shows "\<not>(\<exists>n'>Greatest P. P n')"
lemma cardEx: assumes "finite A" and "finite B" and "card A > card B" shows "\<exists>x\<in>A. \<not> x\<in>B"
lemma cardshift: "card {i::nat. i>n \<and> i \<le> n' \<and> p (n'' + i)} = card {i. i>(n + n'') \<and> i \<le> (n' + n'') \<and> p i}"
translations: lemma disjE3: "P \<or> Q \<or> R \<Longrightarrow> (P \<Longrightarrow> S) \<Longrightarrow> (Q \<Longrightarrow> S) \<Longrightarrow> (R \<Longrightarrow> S) \<Longrightarrow> S"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P \<or> Q \<or> R; P \<Longrightarrow> S;
     Q \<Longrightarrow> S; R \<Longrightarrow> S\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> S
by auto

lemma Greatest_ex_le_nat: assumes "\<exists>k. P k \<and> (\<forall>k'. P k' \<longrightarrow> k' \<le> k)" shows "\<not>(\<exists>n'>Greatest P. P n')"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> (\<exists>n'>Greatest P. P n')
by (metis Greatest_equality assms less_le_not_le)
lemma cardEx: assumes "finite A" and "finite B" and "card A > card B" shows "\<exists>x\<in>A. \<not> x\<in>B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>x\<in>A. x \<notin> B
proof cases

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. ?P \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>x\<in>A. x \<notin> B
 2. \<not> ?P \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>x\<in>A. x \<notin> B
assume "A \<subseteq> B"

 2. \<not> ?P \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>x\<in>A. x \<notin> B
with assms

picking this:
  finite A
  finite B
  card B < card A
  A \<subseteq> B
have "card A\<le>card B"

proof (prove)
using this:

lemma cardshift: "card {i::nat. i>n \<and> i \<le> n' \<and> p (n'' + i)} = card {i. i>(n + n'') \<and> i \<le> (n' + n'') \<and> p i}"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

proof -

let ?f="\<lambda>i. i+n''"

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. \<And>x y.
       \<lbrakk>x \<in> {i. n < i \<and> i \<le> n' \<and> p (n'' + i)};
        y \<in> {i. n < i \<and> i \<le> n' \<and> p (n'' + i)}\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> (x + n'' = y + n'') = (x = y)
 2. \<And>x.
       x \<in> {i. n < i \<and>
                   i \<le> n' \<and> p (n'' + i)} \<Longrightarrow>
       x + n'' \<in> {i. n + n'' < i \<and> i \<le> n' + n'' \<and> p i}
 3. \<And>y.
       y \<in> {i. n + n'' < i \<and>
                   i \<le> n' + n'' \<and> p i} \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>x\<in>{i. n < i \<and> i \<le> n' \<and> p (n'' + i)}.
          y = x + n''
